description:
Volga Se Ganga (Ã Â¤ÂµÃ Â¥â€¹Ã Â¤Â²Ã Â¥ï¿½Ã Â¤â€”Ã Â¤Â¾ Ã Â¤Â¸Ã Â¥â€¡ Ã Â¤â€”Ã Â¤â€šÃ Â¤â€”Ã Â¤Â¾) is a collection of 20 short-stories by Rahul Sankrityayan. Rahul Sankrityayan was a true vagabond. He  traveled to far off lands like Russia, Korea, Japan, & China among others. He mastered the languages of these lands and became an authority on cultural studies.

It was first published in 1944 and is considered the greatest Hindi book of modern Indian literature. It has been translated into many languages including Bengali, English, Kannada, Tamil, Malayalam, Telugu, Russian, Chinese, Punjabi and many more. This book is now considered a classic in the history of Indian Literature. The first Bengali translation was published in 1954.
